Get weather data based on specified query parameters

Source: R/get_data.R
get_data_weather.Rd

Get weather data based on specified query parameters

get_data_weather(ccode = NULL, .start = NULL, .end = Sys.Date(), adm = NULL)

Arguments

ccode

Three character ISO country code for country to which data is required. Defaults to NULL which returns data for all countries.
.start

Starting date in YYYY-MM-DD character format of data to retrieve. Defaults to NULL which returns data from the earliest date available.
.end

End date in YYYY-MM-DD character format of data to retrieve. Defaults to current date as speciifed by Sys.Date.
adm

Numeric value for administrative level data required. Possible values are 0 for whole country, 1 for administrative level 1, 2 for administrative level 2 and 3 for administrative level 3. Default is NULL which returns data for all administrative divisions.

Value

A tibble of weather dataset based on specified parameters. If all parameters are kept to default, output is the same as that when get_table is used with tbl_name specified as weather. However, this function will retrieve the full data into a local tibble which will take considerable time. It is therefore recommended that this function be used when the specific data requirements are already clearly determined. For data exploration, get_table shouild be used instead.

Author

Ernest Guevarra

Examples

## Get weather data for the the whole of the UK for all available dates
get_data_weather(ccode = "GBR",
                 adm = 0)

#> # A tibble: 0 x 56
#> # … with 56 variables: source <chr>, date <date>, gid <chr>, country <chr>,
#> #   countrycode <chr>, adm_area_1 <chr>, adm_area_2 <chr>, adm_area_3 <chr>,
